speaker: Patient
text: So, uh, with the losartan, I sometimes forget to take it when I'm on the road. It's just, you know, the schedule's all over the place.

speaker: Clinician
text: I understand. It can be tough with your job. Have you thought about setting reminders on your phone or maybe using a pill organizer?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, I tried the phone reminders, but sometimes I'm driving and can't really stop to take it right then.

speaker: Clinician
text: That makes sense. Maybe we could look into a medication that fits better with your routine. Or, if it's easier, taking it at a consistent time when you're not driving, like before bed?

speaker: Patient
text: I could try before bed. But, uh, would that affect my sleep or anything?

speaker: Clinician
text: Generally, losartan shouldn't affect your sleep. But if you notice anything unusual, we can adjust. It's important to keep your blood pressure stable.
